text: But I tell you that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause 5:22 NU omits “without a cause”. will be in danger of the judgment. Whoever says to his brother, ‘You good-for-nothing!’ 5:22 “You good-for-nothing” is an Aramaic insult, related to the word for “empty” and conveying the idea of empty-headedness. will be in danger of the council. Whoever says, ‘You fool!’ will be in danger of the fire of Gehinnom.5:22 or, Hell
